III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to
Section requirements; staff qualifications.
Description (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
1

Allegation Youth A reported Staff 1 used to look at Youth B naked while she
was at the facility in 2021.
Investigation Interviews:
The following interviews were completed face to face at the
facility with MDHHS Worker on 4/1/25.
Administrator reported Staff 1 does not have discipline in his file,
nor has there been a grievance filed for this type of behavior in
2021. Administrator 1 reported in 2021, they had a quarantine
unit. Any youth who came into the unit would be quarantined for
14 days before allowed out of their room. Administrator reported
Youth B was at the facility from 3/4/21-4/27/21: Youth A was at the
facility from 2/17/21-4/1/21.
Youth A reported she was placed at the facility in 2021. Youth A
reported Staff 1 would look into Youth B’s room and see Youth B
naked or wrapped in a towel. Youth A reported Staff 1 knew Youth
B walked around naked so he would look at her. Youth A reported
Youth B did this all the time and “invited” attention from Staff 1.
Youth A reported Youth B never complained to her about Staff 1’s
behavior nor told her that Staff 1 was doing this. Youth A reported
Youth B would walk to the bedroom door naked and Staff 1 would
open the door. Youth A reported she was walking around in the
hallway and would see him looking at Youth B. Youth A was not
able to provide any more details to these times she alleged Staff 1
purposely looked at Youth B.
The following interviews were completed face to face at the
facility with MDHHS Worker on 4/11/25.
Supervisor reported he has been the supervisor of Staff 1 for the
last three years. Supervisor reported he has never had any
complaints or concerns concerning Staff 1’s work performance or
boundaries. Supervisor reported during quarantine time, there was
a co-ed building, but female staff would work with the female
youth and the male staff would work with the male youth.
Supervisor reported everyone dressed in their own room and
there were not “cross-gender” staff checks unless youth were
taking too long to get ready. Then the additional staff would come
with the other staff to ensure safety.
Staff 2 reported she worked at the facility since 2017 and was
involved in the quarantine unit in 2021. Staff 2 reported they had
very specific protocols due to COVID. Staff 2 reported youth would
stay in their room unless they completed a shower at night. Their
2

quarantine would last two to three weeks. Staff 2 reported youth
would not be wandering in the hallway. Staff 2 reported male staff
were not with the female youth. Staff 2 reported she does not
remember any youth that would constantly be naked in their room
or would walk around in their towels in their rooms. Staff 2
reported if there was someone who was purposely refusing to
wear clothes they would have had an incident report. Staff 2
described Staff 1 as a quiet staff. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 and all
other male staff would not have gone down the female hallways
during this time. Staff 2 reported they have a 1:2 ratio. Male staff
would sit in the lobby of the building. Staff 2 reported she
remembered Youth B and did not have any issues with her taking
her clothes off or always walking around naked or in a towel.
Staff 1 reported he was employed at the facility in 2021. Staff 1
reported he did work in the quarantine area. Staff 1 reported
female staff worked with female youth and male staff worked with
male youth. Staff 1 reported they would sit at the end of the
hallway and check the bedrooms every 15 minutes to make sure
youth were okay. Staff 1 reported there were always other staff
around. Staff 1 reported there was not conversations in 2021
concerning a female youth walking around naked. Staff 1 reported
he never saw a female youth naked. Staff 1 reported that if youth
were walking around naked, they would receive a verbal, then
written warning. Staff 1 reported he never looked at Youth B
naked. Staff 1 could not remember the names of the female youth
from 2021.
On 4/17 and 4/19/25 I attempted to contact Youth B with the last
known phone number. There have been no return phone calls as
of 5/7/25.
Documents:
• Covid-19 Screening Testing and Notification Protocols,
established in 2021 state, “Quarantine is a 14-day protocol
for new intakes whose medical status is unknown.”
• I reviewed the Intake and discharge dates for Youth A and
Youth B. Intakes and discharge dates are in agreement
with Administrator dates provided. The only time frame they
were together was from 3/19/21-4/1/21.
• I reviewed Staff 1’s personnel file. Staff 1 was hired on
9/14/09. The last central registry was completed on
2/24/25. There was no discipline in Staff 1’s file. Staff 1’s
training file is up to date and has completed minimally 25
hours of training since 2021 to present date.
• I reviewed Youth B’s treatment plans:
3

o Youth B preliminary assessment was completed on
3/15/21 with no concerns noted and it was
documented she was in quarantine with limited
access to other youth.
o Youth B’s Initial Treatment Plan was reviewed, dated
3/25/21. “There have been no notable conflicts with
peers or staff since placement.”
• I reviewed Youth A’s treatment plans:
o Youth A’s Initial Treatment plan was completed on
3/9/21. “Youth A’s interactions with certain staff
members have been highly inappropriate and
disrespectful and other times…compliant and
friendly.” Youth A had gone AWOL on 3/2/21 and
has had time outs and loss of privileges to refocus
on “multiple occasions.” Youth A was noted to
threaten physical harm to staff and throw items.
o Youth A’s 35-day assessment was completed on
3/23/21. Youth A’s behavior has becoming more
concerning, and she has become “increasingly
aggressive and defiant…” The report also reports
she has been withdrawn and reluctant to talk to the
therapist. The report noted her to have “manic”
behavior and deemed an “escape risk.” The report
noted recommendations for a Trauma-assessment
to be completed. The report did not note any issues
pertaining to allegations.
Analysis The agency is compliant with this rule. Youth B is unable to be
reached. Youth A’s account of the allegations does not align with
staff protocol in 2021. There are no incident reports that confirm
Youth B refused to dress in her room. All staff and Supervisor
reported during the time of COVID in 2021, male staff would
monitor male staff and female staff would monitor female staff.
Treatment plans are specific and do not mention any issues with
Youth B refusing to dress and report Youth A had a difficult time
adjusting to the facility and increasing aggressive behaviors
towards youth and staff during this time. Staff 1 does not have
discipline in his file nor a concerning reputation in supervising
youth.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
4

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
